alert.note: Alert for Marshall (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 18 at 9:04PM CDT until April 22 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Snake River AT Alvarado affecting Marshall County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Wild Rice River (MN) at Hendrum affecting Norman County. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Snake River AT Alvarado. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 108.0 feet, MODERATE FLOOD STAGE. Overland flooding of local agricultural land. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 105.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this evening to 107.5 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday evening to 103.1 feet early Saturday afternoon. It will rise to 103.5 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 106.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
